title: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Id Software used TED5 for creating levels for Dreams and Galaxy.
What did they use for Vorticons? AFAIK, there was a TED1 (comes with Dangerous Dave In Copyright yadda yadda as found in John Romero's website), so I guess the tool they used was in that line. In any case, was it ever made publicly available as TED5?------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
That's a good question, actually.

I have a folder of Commander Keen games on my old Win95 laptop from at least 1996 (possibly earlier) that includes all the original Commander Keen episodes plus a copy of KEENEDIT.EXE. (Not KeenWright, I mean the REALLY old one that doesn't work very well. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] ) I don't know if that's what they used...I actually highly doubt it, now that I think about it, since the Keen Editor doesn't seem to work with any episode except for Keen 1. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
That old KeenEdit exe you got there is probably the old fan-made editor. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Anyways, yeah, I'd think it was that or something like that, but never released elsewhere than in DDICI.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Yeah, it's a fan-made one. You mean the text one?------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content: That's the one.  I never figured out how to use it...by the time I started modding, the old Keen Editor was totally obsolete.  And any attempts to use it proved quite frustrating. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Do you still have it? I would very much like a copy. (LL used it for her first two mods.)

As I recall it was a simple ASCII kinda editor with intuitive symbols used for each tile, you could only put on 1 tile or sprite at a time, and only the default sprites too I think.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Yep, it was beautiful. I almost registered my copy once (it was $10 or something, just to support him). The program got more buggy than a week-old corpse when you loaded Keen 2 or 3 levels though...--------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Ah, *sigh* I remember making my first level 'Pyramid' with that, filling in every tile individually, no fill or line functions, no ZXC... those were the days...[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content: I actually have transferred it onto my PC, and if you want it I can send it to you.  I've tried to use it, but I haven't really had the incentive to piece together a whole level with it yet.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: What did they use for creating levels?
content:
Why yes please, that would be great.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!
